newsitem.title: CANADA: Noranda U.S. unit gets labor agreement.
newsitem.headline: Noranda U.S. unit gets labor agreement.

text.p: Noranda U.S.A. Inc, a unit of Noranda Inc, said Tuesday that a negotiated agreement with employees at its Scottsboro, Alabama plant will increase the company's labor flexibility.

The three-year agreement, already ratified by the United Steelworkers of America, Local 7468, provides a pay raise for existing employees but a lower pay scale for future employees, said Don Trotter, the company's spokesman.
The company and union officials spent four weeks in negotiations, which Trotter described as "outstanding and very cooperative."
Under the terms of the deal, 430 employees at the plant will receive a US$0.24 per hour increase in the first year followed by a US$0.10 increase in each of the remaining two years of the contract.
But new employees hired on after the agreement takes effect will be paid at a "significantly lower rate," providing savings at a time when competition in aluminum sales is heating up, Trotter said.
The Scottsboro plant has an average annual capacity of 300 million tonnes of aluminum products, Trotter said.
